bibl.title: Letter from Alberto Recio to Philip Showalter Hench, January 16, 1942

div1.p: Recio informs Hench that the survey of the Camp Lazear site has been delayed, but that the Cuban Minister of Defense still supports the memorial.

div1.head: Letter from Alberto Recio to Philip Showalter Hench, January 16, 1942
div1.opener:
DR. ALBERTO RECIO
HABANA
January 16, 1942.
P. S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Having been away from Havana, I am
answering your letter of Dec. 20th. with some delay.

In regards to your first question,
I am sorry to say that I have unable thus far to have our
engineers survey the true site of Camp Lazear. There has
been a number of changes in our personnel and other dif-
ficulties to account for this.

As to Dr. Ramos, he is still Minis-
ter of Defense. He has his hands full at present and I
think he is unable to give much thought to things outside
his immediate duties. Right now he is in Miami in con-
ference with the Governors of the Southern States. I can
assure you, nevertheless, of the enthusiasm he feels to-
wards your suggestion of paying a lasting tribute to the
men of Camp Lazear, a suggestion which I ardently hope
might soon crystalize.

I take this opportunity to wish you
a Happy New Year.
